basics.name: Lenox Covington
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

highlights: Designed, developed, and maintained RESTful APIs using TypeScript to power key features of a mobile app, including location search, user interactions, and business data management
Integrated third-party APIs (Google Places, PositionStack) and databases (MongoDB, Neo4j) to provide robust location-based services and personalized recommendations
Optimized app performance by implementing caching mechanisms with AWS S3, reducing API call volume and improving load times
Contributed to the full software development lifecycle, participating in Agile methodologies (daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives) and ensuring code quality through testing (Jest)
Developed image processing software using Python to identify and count insect species in hyperspectral images
Utilized near-infrared hyperspectral imaging and trained a Linear Discriminant Analysis model to classify pixels with 98% accuracy
Implemented algorithms to identify the species of individual insects, eliminating the need for manual counting and saving thousands of man-hours per year
Leveraged libraries such as scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy for data processing and machine learning
Manage a fund of $133,000, supporting early-stage startups affiliated with the University of Hawaii
Lead a team of 11 associates in sourcing and evaluating investment opportunities, conducting due diligence, and providing strategic guidance to portfolio companies
Organize meetings, assign roles, and provide mentorship to new team members
Connect startups with resources and organizations, fostering the growth of the entrepreneurial community
